Title: Xen: Privilege Escalation
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in Xen's bundled QEMU version might allow privilege
    escalation.

Description.Text: In CIRRUS_BLTMODE_MEMSYSSRC mode the bitblit copy routine cirrus_bitblt_cputovideo fails to check wethehr the specified memory region is safe.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code with privileges of Xen (QEMU) process on the host, gain privileges on the host system, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text:
Running guests in Paravirtualization (PV) mode, or running guests in Hardware-assisted virtualizion (HVM) utilizing stub domains mitigate the issue.

Running HVM guests with the device model in a stubdomain will mitigate the issue.

Changing the video card emulation to stdvga (stdvga=1, vga=”stdvga”, in the xl domain configuration) will avoid the vulnerability.
